text: Sol Polansky (November 7, 1926 - January 6, 2016) was an American diplomat. He served as the Ambassador to Bulgaria from 1987 until 1990. He joined the United States Foreign Service in 1957. While in the Foreign Service, he was stationed in the Soviet Union, Poland, West Germany, East Germany and Austria. Polansky was born Newark, New Jersey. He studied at the University of California, Berkeley and Columbia University. Polansky died after a long illness on January 6, 2016, aged 89. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Ambassadors of the United States to East Germany Category:American diplomats Category:Columbia University alumni Category:Politicians from Newark, New Jersey
